EverydayAI Newark

Community AI training program offering free courses to Newark residents and corporate training packages, bridging the gap between students and industry opportunities

EverydayAI Newark is a comprehensive AI training initiative designed to democratize access to AI education while creating direct pathways between students and corporate opportunities. As Director of the BS Enterprise AI program at NJIT, I've seen firsthand the gap between what students learn and what employers need. This program bridges that gap.

Program Structure

Free Community Training

A 4-week intensive program for Newark residents covering:

  • Week 1: AI Fundamentals - Understanding what AI actually is and isn't
  • Week 2: Practical AI Tools - ChatGPT, Claude, and productivity applications
  • Week 3: AI in Your Industry - Sector-specific use cases and applications
  • Week 4: Career Readiness - Resume building, interview prep, portfolio development

Target Audience: Newark residents, career changers, displaced workers, students
Cost: Completely free
Location: Newark community centers, libraries, NJIT facilities
Commitment: 2 hours/week for 4 weeks

Corporate Training Packages

Professional development programs for companies looking to upskill their workforce:

  • Starter Package ($2,000): Half-day workshop for up to 20 employees

    • AI tools overview and hands-on practice
    • Industry-specific use cases
    • Implementation roadmap

  • Professional Package ($5,000): Two-day intensive for up to 30 employees

    • Deep dive into AI applications
    • Custom workflow integration
    • 30-day follow-up support

  • Enterprise Package ($10,000): Four-week transformation program

    • Comprehensive AI strategy development
    • Department-specific training tracks
    • 90-day implementation support
    • Executive briefings and ROI tracking

Career Bridge Program

Connecting trained students with hiring companies:

  • Vetted student portfolio showcasing real AI project work
  • Direct introductions to hiring managers in my 1,837-person LinkedIn network
  • Interview preparation and salary negotiation coaching
  • 6-month career support post-placement

Why This Matters

After 20+ years teaching at NJIT, creating 2 degree programs, and teaching 10,000+ students, I've seen the disconnect between education and employment. Students graduate with skills but no network. Companies need talent but don't know how to evaluate AI competency. Newark residents face barriers to entry.

EverydayAI Newark solves all three problems simultaneously.

The Problem

  • Students: Learn theory but struggle to land first job
  • Newark Residents: Locked out of tech opportunities by geography and access
  • Companies: Can't find qualified AI talent, don't know where to look

The Solution

  • Free Training: Remove financial barriers for Newark community
  • Corporate Revenue: Fund sustainability through B2B training packages
  • Direct Connections: Leverage my network to create real opportunities
  • Proven Curriculum: Battle-tested content from teaching 10,000+ students

Impact Metrics (Goals for Year 1)

  • 100 Newark residents trained through free community program
  • 10 corporate clients engaged for paid training packages
  • 25 student placements into full-time roles via Career Bridge
  • $100,000 revenue from corporate training to sustain free programs
  • Monthly Town Halls bringing together students, professionals, and community

Monthly Town Hall Series

Central to the program is a monthly Town Hall event where:

  • Industry professionals share real hiring needs and skills gaps
  • Students present projects and get feedback from practitioners
  • Community members learn about career pathways in AI
  • Companies meet pre-vetted talent from our training programs

First Town Hall: January 9, 2026
Format: Hybrid (in-person + LinkedIn Live)
Audience: Students, professionals, Newark residents, corporate partners

What Makes This Different

Most AI training programs are either:

  1. Too expensive ($5,000+ bootcamps that exclude working-class students)
  2. Too theoretical (university courses disconnected from industry needs)
  3. Too basic ("AI 101" courses that don't lead to employment)

EverydayAI Newark combines:

  • Free access funded by corporate training revenue
  • Practical skills based on real employer needs
  • Direct connections through my 1,837-person network
  • Proven track record from 20+ years at NJIT

Partnership Model

  • NJIT: Academic credibility, facilities, student pipeline
  • Newark Community Centers: Local reach, trust, accessibility
  • Corporate Partners: Funding, hiring opportunities, curriculum input
  • My LinkedIn Network: 1,837 connections across FAANG, finance, startups

Timeline

  • November 2025: Finalize curriculum, secure community center partnership
  • December 2025: Corporate outreach, recruit Town Hall panelists
  • January 2026: Launch first free community cohort + inaugural Town Hall
  • Q1 2026: Onboard 3-5 corporate clients for paid training
  • Q2 2026: First Career Bridge placements, evaluate and iterate

Technical Foundation

The program leverages my experience:

  • Creating BS Enterprise AI degree (300+ students enrolled)
  • Developing MS Data Science program (200+ graduates)
  • Teaching 8 core AI courses over 20 years
  • CTO experience at startup (acquired by Anthem Ventures)
  • International consulting (Zambia workforce development)

Revenue Sustainability

Year 1 Projection:

  • 5 corporate Starter packages ($2K × 5 = $10K)
  • 3 corporate Professional packages ($5K × 3 = $15K)
  • 1 corporate Enterprise package ($10K × 1 = $10K)
  • Total: $35,000 (conservative estimate)

This covers:

  • Free community training materials and space
  • Career coaching and placement support
  • Town Hall event costs
  • Program administration

Year 2-3 Goals: Scale to 10-15 corporate clients, 200+ free community participants, 50+ career placements

Get Involved

  • Newark Residents: Apply for free training (launching January 2026)
  • Companies: Book corporate training or become hiring partner
  • Students: Join Career Bridge program for placement support
  • Everyone: Attend monthly Town Hall events

This isn't just a training program. It's a movement to democratize AI education and create real economic opportunity in Newark.
